meanings.definition: Surrounded or besieged by a crowd or group of people.
meanings.sent1: The gheraoed building was packed with excited fans waiting for the concert.
meanings.sent2: The politician felt gheraoed by reporters asking tough questions.
meanings.sent3: The gheraoed classroom erupted into laughter when the teacher told a joke.
meanings.sent4: Feeling gheraoed by deadlines, she worked tirelessly to finish her project.
meanings.sent5: The gheraoed street was filled with protesters chanting slogans.

meanings.definition: Encircled or blocked off by a barrier or obstacle.
meanings.sent1: The gheraoed castle was protected by high walls and a moat.
meanings.sent2: The hikers found themselves gheraoed by a dense forest with no clear path.
meanings.sent3: The gheraoed car struggled to find a parking spot in the crowded lot.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt gheraoed by sadness after the loss of her beloved pet.
meanings.sent5: The gheraoed island was isolated from the rest of the world by rough seas.
